items.content_html:
• Removed compat notes at Firefox for Android. The notes aren't relevant, e.g. sidebars were never supported on Android.
  • Fix out-of-date claims about bugs in support on Firefox desktop.

References:

  • support for permissions.request in popup: https://bugzil.la/1432083
  • (lack of) support for permissions.request in sidebar: https://bugzil.la/1493396
  • support for permissions.request from an embedded options page in about:addons: https://bugzil.la/1382953
items.title: Fix compat notes for Firefox of permissions.request

items.content_html: Code examination of https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/266031/webkit indicates that support for compactDisplay, currencySign, notation, signDisplay, unit, unitDisplay, currencyDisplay: 'narrowSymbol', and style: 'unit' wasn’t added until 2020-08-22 — and didn’t make it into Safari 14 (confirmed by testing), which was released 2020-09-16. Fixes #9319.
items.title: Mark Intl.NumberFormat support partial in Safari

items.content_html: I changed Safari's version_added from false to "10" in accordance to #9328.
items.title: Fix isPointInPath Path Parameter support info

items.content_html:
• Summarize your changes
    1. Added schemeful SameSite subfeature
    2. Corrected Lax_default secure_context_required statuses for Chromium-based browsers
    3. Added Lax_default secure_context_required statuses for some Android browsers
  • Data: link to resources that verify support information (such as browser's docs, changelogs, source control, bug trackers, and tests)
    1. → 38ab4be
    • Flag added in Chrome 86: issue 1102429, diff between Chromium 85 and 86
    • Flag added in Firefox 79: bug 1638358
    • Opera 72 is based on Chromium 86: release notes
    • Opera for Android 61 is based on Chromium 86: Google Play (Internet Archive), APKMirror
    1. → 8832444 edfe37c
    • Flags in the Chromium source code were changed in 85
      • The enforcements were rolled out to Chrome 80+ but in an out-of-bounds manner
      • Diff between Chromium 84 and 85
      • Revised Chrome Platform Status for Lax_default and secure_context_required
    • The enforcements are coming to Edge 86: Microsoft Edge documentation
    • Opera 71 is based on Chromium 85: release notes
    1. → 9c02380
    • There is no Firefox for Android 69 ~ 78 due to Fenix transition: Firefox version history
    • Opera for Android 60 is based on Chromium 85: Google Play (Internet Archive), APKMirror
  • Data: if you tested something, describe how you tested with details like browser and version
    All the changes were manually tested with the corresponding versions on macOS and Android Virtual Device with Developer Tools. It was a doozy.
  • Review the results of the linter and fix problems reported (If you need help, please ask in a comment!)
  • Link to related issues or pull requests, if any
    Fyrd/caniuse#5794
items.title: SameSite: Add schemeful, corrections, statuses for Android browsers

items.content_html: Webkit feature status says date, datetime-local, and time input is supported as of October 2020, but no release seems to have included that support yet. Technology preview releases have included support since at least TP 114 which should be included in the next version: 15. CanIUse agrees that support is present in current tech previews, though lacking week and month support.
items.title: Desktop Safari adds date/time input support in v15

items.content_html:
The current data says it's available in <= 79. this conflicts with caniuse (https://caniuse.com/?search=unhandledrejection) as well as not making much sense and also conflicting with my own testing - I verified it's available in Edge 88; and it's also been in Chrome for a while. As 79 is the first Edge based on the same code base as Chrome, it seems far more likely that Edge >=79 is the correct range of Edge versions with support - or certainly more correct than the <=79 range.

My test in edge was basically

window.addEventListener("unhandledrejection", (e) => console.log("unhandled rejection handler fired"));
Promise.reject("error")

The catch is that the rejected promise needs to be executed in the web page - if you reject a promise in the console, it doesn't trigger the unhandledrejection handler. The exception handler however can be set in the console.

and then saw the text console.log'ed
items.title: fix unhandledrejection_event / onunhandledrejection edge compatibility

items.content_html:
Inexplicably, the interface uses in1 for the corresponding element's in attribute.

Fixes #9337.
items.title: Rename SVGFECompositeElement.in back to in1

items.content_html:
I have confirmed that:

  1. CSSStyleDeclaration has no @@iterator under all IEs as they don't support Symbol.
  2. Chrome has implemented CSSStyleDeclaration[Symbol.iterator] since 51. Under 50 and below, we have to transform it into Array by calling Array.from() before iteration.
  3. Firefox has implemented with Symbol.iterator at the same time since 36.
  4. Opera has implemented with Symbol.iterator at the same time since 30.

Feel free to update the null value of other browsers when ensuring the version added or nonexistent feature.
items.title: Add a note of CSSStyleDeclaration's @@iterator

items.content_html:
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/obsolete.html#navigatorplugins

Related mdn/content change: mdn/content#2869
items.title: Deprecate NavigatorPlugins, its subfeatures, and related objects

items.content_html:
Intl.NumberFormat Unified API is Supported in Safari 14.1.

Examples for testing could be found here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/NumberFormat/NumberFormat

Safari 14.1 is available for Apple Developers program members

A checklist to help your pull request get merged faster:

  • Summarize your changes
  • Data: link to resources that verify support information (such as browser's docs, changelogs, source control, bug trackers, and tests)
  • Data: if you tested something, describe how you tested with details like browser and version
  • Review the results of the linter and fix problems reported (If you need help, please ask in a comment!)
  • Link to related issues or pull requests, if any
items.title: Add Intl.NumberFormat Unified API support in Safari 14.1

items.content_html:
I am working on mdn/content#2506 the discussion there explains why I am making these changes.

Of the three pseudo-classes :visited had a separate subsection about this, I've removed that and updated all three to add notes explaining current status.
items.title: updating link matching behavior for :link, :visited, :any-link

items.content_html:
The default HTTP Referrer-Policy changed from no-referrer-when-downgrade to strict-origin-when-cross-origin in Firefox 87 (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1589074) as a result of this spec change: whatwg/fetch#1066. The change will also affect chrome and others.

In addition, the MDN page has some notes about setting the default which I understand we'd now include in BCD (reproduced below):

This first draft just puts all of these things as notes . What I THINK needs to happen is that we have a new subfeature to indicate the version at which strict-origin-when-cross-origin is used as the default. So if this is false or unknown the assumption is that the default is no-referrer-when-downgrade. Does that make sense? The other notes from the box above would then be re-worked without all the detail about the "default default" :-)

Does that make sense? If so, any suggestions for the feature name and description?

@ddbeck Your advice appreciated.

Note, this impacts FF content update: mdn/content#2516
items.title: HTTP Referrer-Policy - change to default
Add spec_url for CSS selectors A-F

items.content_html:
In certain circumstances, Safari will incorrectly resolve url() values relative to the document instead of the stylesheet. It's a bit of an edge case, but there's two WebKit bugs and a BCD issue about it (#9075), so I figured that justified a note.

See for details about the bug itself and the fix: https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/267951/webkit

Fixes #9075
items.title: Note Safari bug resolving CSS variables and url()
Add data for Web Serial API.

items.content_html:
This PR removes irrelevant flag data for Firefox and Firefox Android for the AnimationTimeline API as per the corresponding data guidelines.

This PR was created from results of a script designed to remove irrelevant flags.
items.title: Remove irrelevant flags in Firefox for AnimationTimeline API

items.content_html:
This PR removes irrelevant flag data for Firefox and Firefox Android for the Animation API as per the corresponding data guidelines.

This PR was created from results of a script designed to remove irrelevant flags.
items.title: Remove irrelevant flags in Firefox for Animation API
